str2: A male human being; a man, husband. A primary word; a man.
From sunago; an assemblage of persons; specially, a Jewish 'synagogue'; by analogy, a Christian church.
Present participle of archo; a first.
Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.
Jairus, a Jewish ruler of the synagogue. Of Hebrew origin; Jairus, an Israelite.

str2: A reduplicated and contracted form of peto; probably akin to petomai through the idea of alighting; to fall.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
